title: Enhancing Teaching Practice Competencies: Online Focus Group Interview Design for Veterinary Education Research

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate understanding of veterinary medicine fundamentals and educational research methodologies
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can utilize Zoom Annotate functions required to design and execute online focus group interviews with 80% accuracy.
Learners develop five open-ended questions that facilitate participant interaction in the context of veterinary education research.
Learners apply a framework to comprehensively analyze qualitative/quantitative data collected via digital platforms.

Learners will collect at least 15 qualitative research data points within 6 months using online survey tools (e.g., Google Form, Qualtrics) and anonymized video interview platforms (e.g., Loom, Zoom anonymous recording), without geographical constraints, and implement a process that meets at least 4 out of 5 data integrity verification checklist items.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
